original:
The oldest segment of the population, particularly those aged 90 to 94 years, experienced the most significant percentage point increase, rising from 25.0% in 1990 to 26.4% in 2010. This growth in the aging population has led to an increased demand for social work education and training focused on older adults, as well as for practitioners interested in this demographic.


There is a notable disparity between the number of men and women
